parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name/>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the name of the variable which contains a primary editor reference to this object. This is the variable given in the Insert Unit dialog / name field, in the editor. It can be changed using [[setVehicleVarName]]. <br>
If ''object'' refers to a vehicle that wasn't given a name in the editor, the return value is an empty string, "".
<br>Since it is possible to [[setVehicleVarName]] individually on each PC, the value of [[vehicleVarName]] returned will be [[local]] to the PC on which command is executed. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''vehicleVarName''' object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[vehicleVarName]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>


</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setVehicleVarName]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 19, 2015 - 08:45 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To get variable names referencing an object in mission namespace:
<code>KK_fnc_objectVarNames <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> {
	[[private]] "_names";
	_names <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [];
	{
		[[if]] ([[missionNamespace]] [[getVariable]] _x [[isEqualTo]] _this) [[then]] {
			_names [[pushBack]] _x;
		};
	} [[forEach]] [[allVariables]] [[missionNamespace]];
	_names
};


//example
myGroup <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [[group]] [[player]];
aGroup <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [[group]] [[player]];
[[hint]] [[str]] ([[group]] [[player]] [[call]] KK_fnc_objectVarNames); //["agroup","mygroup"]</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
